title: Too bad it's no longer developed
comment: It's nice that there's an open-source calendar but it's too bad it's no longer developed! It sure needs some interface improvements! :/

title: Much needed but...
comment: Could you make it totally standalone? Basically a To Do/Reminder app that requires absolutely the bare minimum of permissions. Please?

title: Stand alone?
comment: It's not stand alone. You can't make an entry without having an account somewhere. Misleading title & description. I don't want my calendar in a cloud.

title: great version of the old calendar
comment: google kinda messed up their calendar app in my opinion, sure this isn't material but at least it doesn't lag. thank you, devs, for offering this.

title: Not a standalone calendar
comment: this syncs and runs hand in hand with an exchange calendar.  a true independent calendar would not sync with anything.

title: Free as in freedom
comment: This is a free/open source calendar application from the Android Open Source Project.

title: Not a standalone
comment: It syncs with my Google calendar. It shouldn't need an email. At least let me choose which email I want it to use. Uninstalling.

title: Not standalone enough
comment: Need to remove account and email permissions.make it a true standalone calender.I hope it gets improved.

title: Doesnt work.
comment: After download, tried to add new event, froze, stopped working. Deleted.

title: Simple & Perfect
comment: Only if more app's were built on this principal
